TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Kerbal Planetary Base Systems v1.6.15 [28. April 2022]

Articles.Content:
23 minutes ago, Nils277 said:

You won't see this tab when you only have KPBS installed. The LS tab is only visible when a supported LS mod, like USI-LS, TAC or similar, is installed. And only the new parts for this specific LS-Mod are shown in the tab then.
Also when you have an LS mod installed, make sure, that the LS-Tab is enabled in the config file. (You can see how to use the config file in KSPedia). But it is set to be visible by default.

If this does not help, i will need the KSP.log file from KSP installation directory to see what's wrong. 

Added to the TODO list 

Will do. Done

I think the problem is with TAC life support. The version I'm using is not an official 1.1 version and has other issues like command pods not having resources. I guess I should get another LS mod.

Just now, storm_soldier2377 said:

I think the problem is with TAC life support. The version I'm using is not an official 1.1 version and has other issues like command pods not having resources. I guess I should get another LS mod. 

Jep, i think this will be the cause. Too sad that Sarbian retired from KSP. But he/she mentioned, that someone resumes TAC-LS development, maybe there will be functional version again soonTM

Let me know, when the error persists for other LS-Mods.

Just now, Nils277 said:

Jep, i think this will be the cause. Too sad that Sarbian retired from KSP. But he/she mentioned, that someone resumes TAC-LS development, maybe there will be functional version again soonTM

Let me know, when the error persists for other LS-Mods.

Which do you recommend that is updated to 1.1 and easy to switch over? I'm not experienced with mods and have only been using mods for a few weeks or so.

8 minutes ago, storm_soldier2377 said:

Which do you recommend that is updated to 1.1 and easy to switch over? I'm not experienced with mods and have only been using mods for a few weeks or so. 

I personally have always been a fan of USI-LS in combination with DeepFreeze (Continued).
USI-LS is a bit easier than TAC resource wise. But you also have to take care, that the Kerbals are happy and you can't let them stay in a base forever.

If you like it simple, try Snacks! It has not been updated to 1.1.2 officially yet (i think) but Angle-125 posted a rebuild for 1.1.2 here: https://github.com/Angel-125/Snacks/releases/tag/v1.1.5

There is also the very new Kerbalism. In addition to Life Support it also adds many other aspects like radation, communication etc. If you like it complex, this would fit well.

 

@Rafael acevedo There is a bug report filed on github for it here (wasn't me, racer01 was faster). I think it should be available soon. 

Edited May 3, 2016 by Nils277
Thanks

13 hours ago, stali79 said:

Sorry for the double post. have added the log file and a couple of other screenshots.

What version of Pathfinder are you using, and did you install from CKAN? If you used CKAN, don't. CKAN is notoriously unreliable with my mods. Instead, pull the latest (0.9.18) From GitHub. I fixed a couple of things unrelated to the issue you're seeing, but with the latest KPBS, Pathfinder, and KIS, I don't see the issues you're seeing.
@Nils277, yep, all working fine now, thanx a lot

Edited May 4, 2016 by Nils277
@stali79 Please give Pathfinder 0.9.19 a try, it should fix the issues you were having with KPBS and Pathfinder.

@stali79 I have found the error (i mixed up some naming and made the wrong nodes impassable for CLS) I will fix that in the next update.

As a workaround, open the file "GameData/PlanetaryBaseInc/ModSupport/Configs/KPBS_MM_CLS.cfg and replace: 

@PART[KKAOSS_engine_g]:FOR[PlanetarySurfaceStructures]:NEEDS[ConnectedLivingSpace]:HAS[!MODULE[ModuleConnectedLivingSpace]]
{
    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleConnectedLivingSpace
        passable = true
        impassablenodes = front, back, leg_1, leg_2
    }
}

to: 

@PART[KKAOSS_engine_g]:FOR[PlanetarySurfaceStructures]:NEEDS[ConnectedLivingSpace]:HAS[!MODULE[ModuleConnectedLivingSpace]]
{
    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleConnectedLivingSpace
        passable = true
        impassablenodes = top, bottom, leg1, leg2
    }
}

 

Edited May 4, 2016 by Nils277

15 hours ago, Angel-125 said:

@stali79 Please give Pathfinder 0.9.19 a try, it should fix the issues you were having with KPBS and Pathfinder.

Tried it, and it worked  thanks man.

Hey Nils, 

I did not have much time for KSP during the last weeks, just updated to the current version of PBS and tried to parachute-land one of my Base packs (central hub plus 3 modules) on kerbin. 

unfortunately, i experience behavior similar to the issues that occurred at the 1.0 release version of PBS: 

invisible modules that only reappear when finally (blind) landed, sometimes I can't switch between modules already hanging on the chutes  ( "can't switch between vessel while in flight"- message) or when able to switch, i find that the chutes were cut :-(

does anybody experience similar behavior?

my base was built and tested with KSP 1.0.5 and PBS 1.0.x, KSP and PBS are updated to current versions.

best regards, Martin

2 hours ago, stali79 said:

I tried the MM patch with no success. Here is a screenshot of the settings I had to change to make it work, I suspect the issue MAY be on the CLS side of things?

The problem is most probably related to a wrong CLS config i made. I have to take a look at the other configs for CLS as well so find the error.

Hmm, have you deleted the old folder of PBS before installing the new one? Might be an old plugin still being around. Also, do you have the newest version of PBS? It might be an error with the IVAs i fixed recently. They caused a lot od weird errors.

If this does not help, i need a log so see what is going wrong. Can you send me one from when you tried to land the parts? (Just try to land and send me the log that is created) You can see where to find the log here here.
